page.title: 29Hucknall - An Overview
page.content:
Hucknall (pop. 29,704) is a market town in the Leen Valley, within Ashfield District and Sherwood Constituency. It was once a centre for framework knitting and mining, but engineering (Rolls-Royce) and manufacturing (Doff Portland) have become important industries of late. Hucknall is a dormitory town for Nottingham, with excellent bus, train and tram links. Famous local people include the poet Lord Byron, composer Eric Coates, computer programmer Ada Lovelace and Olympic hurdler Andy Turner.
David Heathcote
